thread.title: Soccer: Maryville turns table on Bearden - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Soccer: Maryville turns table on Bearden - PrepXtra Story

author: Dave Link
title: Soccer: Maryville turns table on Bearden - PrepXtra
text:
It was payback time for the Maryville High School girls soccer team Tuesday night.
Junior goalkeeper Allie Hendrix posted eight saves and the fourth-seeded Lady Rebels beat top-seeded Bearden 1-0 in the District 4-AAA elimination semifinals.
Last year, Maryville (14-4-2) was the top-seeded team in the district and was eliminated in the semifinals by fourth-seeded Bearden, 2-0. It was the only loss of the season for Maryville, which finished 17-1-2.
"It's a little sweeter because it's a bit of payback for what they did last year," Maryville coach Bill Stooksbury said. "I know they're hurting. We hurt last year. It's just very ironic how it was flipped this year."
Maryville will play at Hardin Valley Academy on Thursday for the district championship and home-field advantage in the Region 2-AAA semifinals.
Bearden (15-3-2) had 10 shots on goal to two for visiting Maryville, which put heavy defensive pressure on Lady Bulldogs forwards Casey Riemer and Taylor Frizen.
"They had a good game plan," Bearden coach Ryan Radcliffe said. "It's hard to score against six defenders back there, and their keeper made some big saves.
"They obviously know about Casey and Taylor and what kind of threat they are, and each of them had three (defenders) on 'em. It's hard to break down that wall."
Maryville scored in the 11th minute. Carolyn Hobbs took a shot that was blocked by diving keeper Abby Mink, and Preston Robinette scored on the rebound shot.
"Carolyn had a great shot and it bounced off their keeper," Robinette said. "I was just there to put it in."
Hendrix and the Maryville defense made the goal hold up.
Bearden had six shots on goal in the first half and four in the second half.
With 3 minutes left, Bearden's Emily Carlevato drilled a shot from about 30 yards and Hendrix punched it over the crossbar.
"I thought she had me," Hendrix said of Carlevato's shot. "I'm just really happy I got to it. It was a good shot."
Dave Link is a freelance contributor.
